Package UserLoginRegistration

Class Login

java.lang.Object
UserLoginRegistration.Login
public class Login extends Object
This is a sample light weight database application That can have multiple users and can have multiple tables and database for each user The scope of the login exists beyond the execution of the program as the authentication Information is stored in the log file present at - src/main/java/Assets/userAuth.txt landing page is where the entire application is bootstrapped at.
Since:
Feb 26, 2023

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    captureCurrentUserDetails()
    This function fetches the current user details fron the DTO userAuthDetails This details is used to compare the stored hashed password with the current entered hashed password
    boolean
    checkUserAuthStatus()
    This function compares the current entered hashed password with the stored hashed password
    void
    createDirectoryForUser(String username)
    This function creates a new directory for the new user if it dosent exists
    boolean
    secondFactorAuthentication(boolean firstAuthFlow)
    This function is used to verify the second factor authentication The hint question is fetched from the DTO only if the first auth flow is true If the login is successful the user is redirected to the admin console.
    void
    storeUserDetails()
    This function parses the string that stores the entire file content and finds the username, password, hint question and hint answer in the userAuthDTO The data stored in the DTO list can be used to verify the login credentials of the current user trying to login
    boolean
    verifySecondFactorAuth(String userAnswer, String realAnswer)
    This function compares the hint answer stored and the entered hint answer If they match returns true

  • Constructor Details

    • Login

      public Login(String username, String password)
      Constructor class for the Login class
      Parameters:
      username - sets the username
      password - sets the password

  • Method Details

    • storeUserDetails

      public void storeUserDetails()
      This function parses the string that stores the entire file content and finds the username, password, hint question and hint answer in the userAuthDTO The data stored in the DTO list can be used to verify the login credentials of the current user trying to login

    • captureCurrentUserDetails

      public void captureCurrentUserDetails()
      This function fetches the current user details fron the DTO userAuthDetails This details is used to compare the stored hashed password with the current entered hashed password

    • checkUserAuthStatus

      public boolean checkUserAuthStatus()
      This function compares the current entered hashed password with the stored hashed password
      Returns:
      returns true if the passwords match ! login success!

    • secondFactorAuthentication

      public boolean secondFactorAuthentication(boolean firstAuthFlow)
      This function is used to verify the second factor authentication The hint question is fetched from the DTO only if the first auth flow is true If the login is successful the user is redirected to the admin console.
      Parameters:
      firstAuthFlow - this is the params that is the return value from checkUserAuthStatus method
      Returns:
      returns true if the second auth is successful, redirects to adminConsole

    • verifySecondFactorAuth

      public boolean verifySecondFactorAuth(String userAnswer, String realAnswer)
      This function compares the hint answer stored and the entered hint answer If they match returns true
      Parameters:
      userAnswer - current entered hint answer
      realAnswer - the stored real answer
      Returns:
      returns true if the two params are equal

    • createDirectoryForUser

      public void createDirectoryForUser(String username)
      This function creates a new directory for the new user if it dosent exists
      Parameters:
      username - the current logged in user
